The technology may be too expensive to develop and market, making it unprofitable for the company.
The technology may be vulnerable to hacking or other security threats, putting users' data at risk.
The technology may not be able to meet the regulatory requirements for its release, delaying or even prohibiting its launch.
The technology may have unintended consequences that could harm the environment or public health.
The technology may be too complex for users to understand and use effectively, leading to frustration and low adoption rates.
